crazyballrun.game.physics

Class CollisionTexture

  • java.lang.Object
    • crazyballrun.game.physics.CollisionTexture

  • public class CollisionTexture
extends java.lang.Object
    The CollisionMap represents the collision data of a texture.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  CollisionTexture.GroundProperty
      Defines the result of collisions between rigid bodies and a particular color of the collision texture image.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructor of CollisionMap.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CollisionTexture

        public CollisionTexture()
        Constructor of CollisionMap. Creates the color-ground-mapping.

    • Method Detail

      • getCentrifugal

        public static double getCentrifugal(CollisionTexture.GroundProperty ground)
        Calculates a centrifugal-force value for a particular ground. Low centrigual force means there is high centrifugal effect (for performance reasons, to avoid "1 - centrifugal" calculation in the physics calculation).
        Parameters:
        ground - ground properties
        Returns:
        centrifugal force

      • getFriction

        public static double getFriction(CollisionTexture.GroundProperty ground)
        Calculates a friction-force value for a particular ground.
        Parameters:
        ground - ground properties
        Returns:
        friction force

      • setCollisionTexture

        public void setCollisionTexture(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image)
        Sets the collision texture image for the collision map.
        Parameters:
        image - BufferedImage representing the collision data

      • getGroundProperty

        public CollisionTexture.GroundProperty getGroundProperty(Vector2D point)
        Gets the ground property of a particular point on the texture.
        Parameters:
        point - specified point on the texture (x in [0,1], y in [0,1])
        Returns:
        the ground property of the texture at the specified point.
